intro: Acronia folsomii, commonly known as the Folsom acronia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, and it produces small, yellow to orange flowers. Acronia folsomii is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy species that thrives in full sun.
